member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer
member.summary:
##### Random generator based on the random table.(请注意，这个模块之中的所有函数都是线程不安全的)
###### A Million Random Digits with 100,000 Normal Deviates
Not long after research began at RAND in 1946, the need arose for random numbers that could be used to solve problems of various kinds of experimental probability procedures. These applications, called Monte Carlo methods, required a large supply of random digits and normal deviates of high quality, and the tables presented here were produced to meet those requirements. This book was a product of RAND's pioneering work in computing, as well a testament to the patience and persistence of researchers in the early days of RAND. The tables of random numbers in this book have become a standard reference in engineering and econometrics textbooks and have been widely used in gaming and simulations that employ Monte Carlo trials. Still the largest published source of random digits and normal deviates, the work is routinely used by statisticians, physicists, polltakers, market analysts, lottery administrators, and quality control engineers. A 2001 article in the New York Times on the value of randomness featured the original edition of the book, published in 1955 by the Free Press. The rights have since reverted to RAND, and in this digital age, we thought it appropriate to reissue a new edition of the book in its original format, with a new foreword by Michael D. Rich, RAND's Executive Vice President.
> http://www.rand.org/pubs/monograph_reports/MR1418.html

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.Next
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that is greater than or equal to 0 and less than System.Int32.MaxValue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.GetRandomPercentages(System.Int32)
member.summary: 返回随机的0-1之间的百分比数值

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.NextDouble
member.summary: Returns a random floating-point number that is greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number that is greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.NextBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fills the elements of a specified array of bytes with random numbers.
member.param: An array of bytes to contain random numbers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a non-negative random integer that is less than the specified maximum.
member.param: The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. maxValue must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Mathematical.Randomizer.Next(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a random integer that is within a specified range.
member.param: The inclusive lower bound of the random number returned.
The exclusive upper bound of the random number returned. maxValue must be greater than or equal to minValue.
